question: 出発
sourceMnemonic: You <kanji>exit</kanji> and then make a <kanji>departure</kanji>. This is just a <vocabulary>departure</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>しゅつ</ja> gets shortened and <ja>はつ</ja> changes to <ja>ぱつ</ja>. No wonder you want to make a departure, you want to get away from crazy readings like this.
